p: Luteolin is present in foods such as carrot, cabbage, tea, and apple and is found in Ugni molinae Turcz. [ 73, 74]. Data show that luteolin (50 μg/mL) increases the levels of GSH, the expression of GSH synthetase, and the activity of SOD and CAT in human colon cancer cells (HT-29) [ 75]. Furthermore, luteolin attenuates the sepsis-induced acute lung injury in mice by reducing lipid peroxidation and increasing SOD and CAT activity, in addition to suppressing the NF- κB pathway [ 76].
